problems.title: Number of Squareful Arrays (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

An array is squareful if the sum of every pair of adjacent elements is a perfect square.
Given an integer array nums, return the number of permutations of nums that are squareful.
Two permutations perm1 and perm2 are different if there is some index i such that perm1[i] != perm2[i].
problems.examples:
Sample Input
1 17 8

Sample Output
2

Explanation: [1,8,17] and [17,8,1] are the valid permutations.

Sample Input
2 2 2

Sample Output
1

Explanation: Only [2,2,2] is valid since 2+2=4 is a perfect square.

Sample Input
1 17 8 1

Sample Output
2

Explanation: Valid permutations are [1,8,17,1] and [1,17,8,1].
hintsList: Use backtracking with bitmask to track which indices have been used.
Precompute which pairs of numbers sum to a perfect square.
